docs.title: Home

docs.text: You will find everything you need about this project on this site.
docs.title: Welcome to the RoDeP doc !

docs.text: About the RoDeP project ¶ The RoDeP (standing for "RObot DEplaceur de Plantes" in French, which can be translated by PMORO ("Plant MOver RObot")) project is a collaboration between Sony CSL Paris and Polytech Sorbonne, a graduating school of engineering. It has be given to students of Polytech Sorbonne in the Robotic specialty, as their indusrial project, realised in cooperation with this company. Sony CSL Paris developped a plant scanner, which makes 3D model of vegetable, in order to track their growth. Project funding ¶ The project has been funded by Sony CSL entirely. Work team ¶ 3 teams participated in this project. The first is the student team, including Nicolas BRANAS, Paul CHAMBROUX, Alexandre LEU and Hugo PASQUIER. It has been developped over the course of their 4th year in Polytech Sorbonne. The second team, composed by David COLLIAUX and Peter HANAPPE, is representing Sony CSL. Both of them works in the Sustainability department, which is "commited to build tools for a sustainable society and raise awareness about the challenges of our era". Last but not least, the Polytech Sorbonne team, with Pierre CARLES and Tarik LARJA onboard, supervised the students while they were at the school, both on the technical and the management side of the project. GitHub sources ¶ You will find every ressources for the code part of this project on the Github down below :
docs.title: About

It has be given to students of Polytech Sorbonne in the Robotic specialty, as their indusrial project, realised in cooperation with this company. Sony CSL Paris developped a plant scanner, which makes 3D model of vegetable, in order to track their growth.

docs.text: Gripper components ¶ On this page, you will find every components you need to assemble everything related to the gripper. Support of the gripper ¶ First of all, the components for the support part is here : Number Component Specifications Example 4 Axis 1 Bottom Plate 1 Top plate 1 Gripper motor Step motor Motor 1 Axe vis sans fin 10 Attaches axes/plaques 38 M4x12 Screw 4 Rondelles 2 guides pour vis sans fin 1 Pignon petit 1 Pignon grand The gripping part ¶ The list of the elements found on the gripping part is below : Number Component Specifications Example 2 Axes 4 Attaches 1 Gripper motor Step motor Motor 1 Courroie 2 Pignons 2 Bras 4 Anneaux 4 circlips 1 Capteurs fin de butée 3 Grande vis 2 Attaches aux guides linéaires 1 Attache vis sans fin 14 Boulons 4 Petites vis pour encercler les axes

docs.text: A Rail DIN is a standardized support profile, generally metallic, widely used for the mechanical support of electrical equipment. The Rail DIN system allows us to assemble and disassemble easily the differents electronicals components. Moreover, it offers us the possibility of changing the components whithout having to modifie the frame.
docs.title: Rail DIN system

Building the robot ¶ Building the robot is the first step to ensure the development of the project. Coding ¶ Now is the time to add the code to the robot, so it would move. Testing the robot ¶ If everything is ready, now all you need is to try the robot !
